item.title: Taking the derivative of the softmax function
item.description: The softmax funciton assumes that the scores received from a classifier are unnormalized log probabilities. The softmax function is: \begin{align} L_0 = & \max(0, e^1_0 - w_0^Tx_0 + 1) + \max(0, w_2^Tx_0 - w_0^Tx_0 + 1) \\ L_1 = & \max(0, w_0^Tx_1 - w_1^Tx_1 + 1) + \max(0, w_2^Tx_1 - w_1^Tx_1 + 1) \\ L_2 = & \max(0, w_0^Tx_2 - w_2^Tx_2 + 1) + \max(0, w_1^Tx_2 - w_2^Tx_2 + 1) \\
